description: >**Notes:**
> + The site owners may not allow members to create groups.
> + Specify a `creatorId` to set the group's creator.
> + The group's creator will automatically become an admin.

params.name: groupId
params.doc: ID of the group to delete.

docs.summary: Hides a group from the Group List or cancels group request.
description: >**Notes:**
> + Only admins can delete a group.
> + The group will no longer be visible in the live site or the Wix business manager.
> + It is not possible to restore the group via the [Update Group](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-groups/groups/group/update-group) endpoint into the live site.

> + It is still possible to retrieve the group via the [Get Group](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-groups/groups/group/get-group), [List Groups](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-groups/groups/group/list-groups) and [Query Groups](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-groups/groups/group/query-groups) endpoints.

params.name: groupId
params.doc: ID of the group to retrieve.

params.name: slug
params.doc: Unique part of the group's URL, for example `group-1` in `https:/example.com/groups/group-1`. Pass only the slug. Case-sensitive.

ret.doc:
Contains functionality for refining a groups query.
The `GroupsQueryBuilder` functions enable you to run, sort, filter, and control
which results a query returns.

Typically, you build a query using any of the groups query functions,
refine the query by chaining `GroupsQueryBuilder` functions, and then execute the
query by chaining the [`find()`](#find) function.

For example, the following code queries...:

```javascript
import wixGroupsBackend from 'wix-groups-backend';

wixGroupsBackend.queryGroups()
  .eq("<property1>", "<value1>")
  .ascending("<property2>")
  .limit(5)
  .find()
  .then( (results) => {
    console.log(results.items);
  } );
```

docs.summary: Retrieves up to 100 groups, given the provided paging, filtering, and sorting.
description: Supported fields for filtering:
- `title`
Supported fields for sorting:
- `title`
- `createdDate`
- `membersCount`
- `recentActivityDate`
>**Note:**
> + Only admins can update a group.
> + When `group.privacyLevel` is updated from `PRIVATE` to `PUBLIC`, all pending group join requests are automatically approved.
> + When `group.privacyLevel` is updated from `PRIVATE` to `SECRET`, all pending group join requests are automatically rejected.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Group ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Group title.

members.name: slug
members.doc: A unique part of a group's URL, for example `https:/example.com/groups/slug`.

members.name: description
members.doc: Group description in DraftJS format.

members.name: privacyStatus
members.doc:
Group privacy level.
- `PUBLIC` - Anyone can see the group and its content. Anyone can join the group.
- `PRIVATE` - Anyone can see the group, but only members can see its content. New member must submit a `Join Group Request`.
- `SECRET` - Only admins and members can see the group. New members can only be added by other members.
One of:
 + `"UNKNOWN"`
 + `"PUBLIC"`
 + `"PRIVATE"`
 + `"SECRET"`

members.name: coverImage
members.doc: Group logo. You cannot upload your own logo.

members.name: memberTitle

members.name: memberCount
members.doc: Total count of current group members.

members.name: settings
members.doc: Group specific settings. Available to the site owners under `Admin Tools` in the Business Manager.

members.name: lastActivityDate
members.doc: Date and time of the most recent group activity, for example a post or comment.

members.name: owner
members.doc: Member ID of the group creator.  See [Members API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/about-wix-members) for more details.

examples.title: Query groups
body: *    "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos."
*    "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos."

description: The `updateGroup()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the updated group.
Only site admins and group admins can update their group.
Only the fields in the `groupInfo` object parameter can be updated. Specify which fields to update. Unspecified fields remain the same.
> **Notes:**
+ If the `suppressAuth` option is set to `true`, all permissions are overwritten, and all site members (including non-group members) can update a group.
+ When a group's `privacyStatus` is updated from `PRIVATE` to `PUBLIC`, all pending join requests for that group are automatically approved.
+ When a group's `privacyStatus` is updated from `PRIVATE` to `SECRET`, all pending join requests for that group are automatically rejected.
+ When a public or private group's name is updated, the slug is updated to reflect the new group name.

examples.title: Update a group
body: //   description: 'This is my updated group about cats.',
*   "description": "This is my new group about cats."

examples.title: Update a group with more information
body: //   description: 'This is my updated group about cats.',
*   "description": "This is my new group about cats."

members.name: name
members.doc: Group name.

members.name: description
members.doc: Group description.

members.name: privacyStatus
members.doc:
Group privacy level.
One of:
+ `PUBLIC`: Site visitors can see the group and its content in the list of groups. Site members can join the group. 
+ `PRIVATE`: Site visitors can see the group in the list of groups, but only group members can see its content. Site members can request to join the group.
+ `SECRET`: Only group members can see the group and its content in the list of groups. Site members can only join if invited by group admins, or other group members.

members.name: coverImage
members.doc: Group cover image.

members.name: memberTitle
members.doc: What group members are called. For example, 'Coworkers', 'Friends', or 'Students'.

members.name: settings
members.doc: Group settings.

members.name: owner
members.doc: Site member ID of the group creator. Defaults to group creator. Required if using suppressAuth.

members.name: name
members.doc: Group name.

members.name: description
members.doc: Group description.

members.name: privacyStatus
members.doc:
Group privacy level.
One of:
+ `PUBLIC`: Site visitors can see the group and its content in the list of groups. Site members can join the group. 
+ `PRIVATE`: Site visitors can see the group in the list of groups, but only group members can see its content. Site members can request to join the group.
+ `SECRET`: Only group members can see the group and its content in the list of groups. Site members can only join if invited by group admins, or other group members.

members.doc: What group members are called. For example, 'Coworkers', 'Friends', or 'Students'.

members.doc: Group settings.

members.doc: Site member ID of the group creator.

members.name: groups
members.doc: List of groups.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Paging information.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of groups to retrieve. Defaults to 1,000.

members.name: skip
members.doc: Number of groups to skip in the list.
